'''Wormadam''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ミノマダム''' ''Minomadam'') is a {{type|Bug}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from a [[gender|female]] {{p|Burmy}} starting at [[level]] 20. It is one of Burmy's final forms, the other being {{p|Mothim}}.

It has three different secondary types: {{t|Steel}}, {{t|Grass}}, and {{t|Ground}}, determined by its cloak. Its cloak is permanent and determined by the cloak that Burmy was in when it last battled.
* In its '''Plant Cloak''', it is {{2t|Bug|Grass}}-type.
* In its '''Sandy Cloak''', it is {{2t|Bug|Ground}}-type.
* In its '''Trash Cloak''', it is {{2t|Bug|Steel}}-type.

==Biology==
Wormadam is a black, bagworm-like Pokémon with a coat of leaves, sand, or building insulation that has fused with its body. It has oval eyes, a long pointed beak, and a long antenna with a coiled tip. The beak is tipped with varying colors depending on the coat. The coat forms a pair of arm-like structures near this Pokémon’s head. The Plant Cloak form has several white flowers covering it, and gives Wormadam a green-tipped beak and large leaves for arms. It will be dotted with reddish-brown rocks, and have chains of pebbles for arms and a brown tipped beak if it has the Sandy Cloak. When covered by the Trash Cloak, it has a pink tipped beak and long, dark pink ribbons for arms. Wormadam that evolve on cold days are said to form thicker cloaks. It is a female-only species, with {{p|Mothim}} as its male counterpart.

==In the anime==
[[File:Cheryl Wormadam Plant Cloak.png|thumb|left|220px|Plant Cloak Wormadam in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]

===Major appearances===
[[Cheryl]] has three Wormadam, one of each form. They appeared in ''[[DP030|Some Enchanted Sweetening!]]''.

A Sandy Cloak Wormadam appeared in ''[[DP114|Another One Gabites the Dust!]]'', under the ownership of [[Ursula]]. She used it in the [[Appeal|Performance Stage]] of the {{to|Chocovine}} {{pkmn|Contest}}, allowing Ursula to move on to the [[Contest Battle]]s.

===Minor appearances===
A group of Plant Cloak Wormadam appeared in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]''.

A Plant Cloak Wormadam appeared in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]''.

A Plant Cloak Wormadam briefly appeared in ''[[XY049|Bonnie for the Defense!]]''.

All three forms of Wormadam appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'' as several of the Pokémon seen at [[Nebel Plateau]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Meragura Volcano various Pokémon.png|thumb|Plant Cloak Wormadam in [[Pokémon Try Adventure]]]]
===In the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga===
Wormadam was first seen in a Sandy Cloak under the ownership of one of the members of the [[Celestic Town]] brigade that Cynthia assembled in ''[[PS384|Maddening Magby]]''.

A Trash Cloak Wormadam was used by a {{tc|Youngster}} that {{adv|Platinum}} watched at the [[Battle Frontier (Generation IV)# Battle Factory|Battle Factory]] in ''[[PS426|Softening Up Kakuna]]''.

In ''[[PS435|The Final Dimensional Duel V]]'', a Plant Cloak Wormadam appeared on [[Fullmoon Island]] in {{FB|Tower Tycoon|Palmer}}'s flashback.

===In [[Pokémon Try Adventure]] manga===
Several Plant Cloak Wormadam were seen around [[Meragura Volcano]].

==Trivia==
[[File:School Kid Ann Sandy Wormadam Leaf Storm BW.png|frame|Sandy Cloak Wormadam using Leaf Storm in {{v2|Black and White|s}}]]
* Wormadam is the only Pokémon with [[List of Pokémon with form differences|forms]] of different types that cannot switch between its forms.
* Wormadam and its {{p|Burmy|pre-evolution}} share their {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Pineco}} and {{p|Forretress}}. They are all known as the Bagworm Pokémon.
* Wormadam and {{p|Mothim}} are the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 424.
* In {{game|Black and White|s}}, School Kid Ann on {{rt|12|Unova}} has a Sandy Cloak Wormadam that knows {{m|Leaf Storm}}, a move that Sandy Cloak Wormadam [[Game move errors|cannot learn by any means]]; it is instead learned by Plant Cloak Wormadam.
* Prior to Generation VI, Wormadam's body style was [[File:Body02.png]].
* Prior to Generation VII, all Wormadam forms were classified by Pokédex color sorting as gray.
===Origin===
Wormadam is based on an adult female {{wp|bagworm}}, which never develops wings.

====Name origin====
Wormadam is a combination of ''{{wp|bagworm}}'' and ''madam'' (indicating its exclusively female nature).

Minomadam is a combination of 蓑虫 ''minomushi'' (bagworm) and ''madam''.
